result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Charles Widucki Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter Charles Widucki appears via telephone. Called 3:13 PM. FTR recorded. Court questions why this was scheduled for today. Widucki indicates he was told by COC office to request hearing to avoid a warrant. Widucki indicates he recently made payment and will be in by the end of this week to make another payment to get caught up.
Payment hearing on October 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter Charles Widucki in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:49 PM. State - here for final pre-trial and there is a resolution, has complied with victim notification, defendant would plead to counts 1 & 4, Counts 2 & 3 DRI. Counts 1 & 4 - $100 fine plus costs on each count, 120 days in jail on each count, concurrent. State indicates offer contained either jail or probation, defendant is choosing jail sentence. Court DRI counts 2 & 3. Defendant pleads G to counts 1 & 4. Court has PLQ and goes over form with defendant, finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving constiutional rights, court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final argument, state does not object to expunction and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument, asks for expunction and asks to follow joint recommendation. Widucki with holds comment. Burns asks for time to report to set up huber. Court sentences to the following: Count 1 - 120 days in FC jail, $100 fine plus costs - take bond posted; count 4 - 120 days in FC jail, concurrent to count 1, $100 fine plus costs. Jail with huber, good time, 7 days of jail credit, must report 4/8/16 at 8:30 AM, eligible for community service under 973.03(3), will authorize expunction upon successful completion of sentence. Burns asks for payment plan commencing August 15th at rate of $50/month CO. Must submit DNA sample.
Final pre-trial on March 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter Charles Widucki in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:13. State - asking to start PH and then continue at another date and two of the witnesses that were served are not in court and will be requesting a material witness warrant for them. Discussion on whether or not to proceed. Court will allow the State to start the PH and will determine later if it needs to be continued. State calls Jared Schneider. Schneider sworn in at 1:18 PM. Burns asks for sequestration of witnesses. Court sequestors witnesses. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Burns at 1:26 PM. Re-direct by State at 1:27 PM. Court asks questions of witness (1:28 PM). Schneider excused and is released from subpoena. State calls Deputy Novak. Novak sworn in at 1:30 PM. Direct exam by State. Burns objects - no evidence - sustained (1:35 PM). Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (1:37 PM). Cross exam by Burns at 1:41 PM. Re-direct by State at 1:43 PM.  Re-cross by Burns at 1:44 PM. Novak excused at 1:44 PM. State believes it has met his burden for a bind over but again reminds Court that two of his subpoenaed material witnesses did not appear for Court today. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, will bind over for trial. State will be filing an Information that mirrors the complaint but does not have it with him. Burns will waive the reading of Information as long as it mirrors the complaint and will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues bond, accepts plea, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter Charles Widucki in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:29 AM. Burns has complaint and defendant understands charges, waives further reading, waives time limits and requests PH. Court considers time limits waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
